com.yantra.api.omp.promising

Interface importAvailabilityCache

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface importAvailabilityCache

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document importAvailabilityCache(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The importAvailabilityCache API imports inventory alerts data in batch mode.

    • Method Detail

      • importAvailabilityCache

        org.w3c.dom.Document importAvailabilityCache(YFSEnvironment env,
                                             org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                      throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                             java.rmi.RemoteException

        The importAvailabilityCache API imports inventory alerts data in batch mode. If the record already exist, the inventory alert data will be updated. This API may also be used to create a list of inventory alerts to manage Inventory cache for Items. On successful execution the real-time availability event will be raised containing the list of record changes occurred during the API call.

        Note: The published event will use the output of the api hence attributes required in the event should not be removed from the output template of the api.
        When cassandra database is enabled all record will be maintained in INV_INVENTORY_AVAILABILITY otherwise they will be maintained in YFS_INVENTORY_ALERTS table.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: The Following Event is raised.

        • REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE_LIST:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of the importAvailabilityCache API.
          Data published - YFS_REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE_LIST.xml
          Key data - AVAILABILITY_MONITOR_dbd.txt
          Template Support - No: Template conforms to the API output template.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
